div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h2.a: VIDEO FROM YOUR TEACHERS AND STAFF HERE AT THE FARM. WE MISS YOU!!!!!!!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: April 14, 2020
Dear Aggies,

On Tuesday, April 14, 2020, Governor Reeves announced that school buildings would remain closed for the remainder of the semester, but instructional services would be continued through distance and on-line learning platforms. While we are heartbroken that we will not be finishing the semester as we normally do, we do understand that this measure is necessary to keep our students, staff, and families safe by supporting the efforts to prevent the spread of COVID-19. Please know that we miss our students!

We realize that this announcement brings many feelings of uncertainty and disappointment. Please know that we, too, are experiencing a range of emotions and are working to make the best of this situation. The decision to remain closed may raise many questions, as it does for the FCAHS team. We have been working on answers to many of your questions and will continue to do so as we await the official executive order from Governor Reeves.
Here’s what we do know as of today:
· School buildings will be closed for traditional classes for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.
· Instruction will continue via Google Classroom. For those who need instructional packets for the remainder of the semester, those packets will be delivered on Tuesday, April 21.
· All MHSAA events and athletics are cancelled.
· Meals for students will continue.
· Tech support (by appointment) and counseling support are still available each Wednesday.
· All of the community centers in Forrest County are WIFI hotspots as is Jeff Martin Auctions.
· Students who are enrolled in dual credit classes with PRCC will need to meet the criteria that is provided by the college.

Once we receive the official Executive Order from the governor’s office, we will send out further information on course grades and course credits. We are looking at options for our graduation ceremony for the Class of 2020. While we are looking at options, more importantly, we are collecting information from the seniors as to what their wishes are for a ceremony.

We have set up an email for your questions if you are not sure who to contact. We will route your questions to the appropriate person. The email is info@forrestcountyahs.com. You may also leave a voice mail at 601-582-4741 if you don’t have an email. We will be happy to respond to your questions.

Please continue to follow any state and/or local orders as well as the CDC’s COVID-19 guidance to keep your families safe and healthy. Thank you for your continued patience and support during this unprecedented time.
Sincerely,
Donna Boone
Informational Links:
Coronavirus info from CDC: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/index.html

C Spire: For more information about C Spire’s response to the COVID-19 public health emergency and free wireless data for students, visit https://www.cspire.com/cms/wireless/cspire-cares-covid-19-relief/ and click on the C Spire Cares update. For details on C Spire products and services, visit www.cspire.com.
Mississippi Department of Education: www.mdek12.org/LearningAtHome
AT&T Access: Internet for households with students receiving free lunch at $10 a month. Call 1-855-220-5211
Comcast Internet K-12: Free internet service to low-income families during the coronavirus outbreak. Visit https://www.internetessentials.com/

For Forrest County Agricultural High School students: Jeff Martin Auctioneers at 2236 Highway 49 in Brooklyn. Park in front lot.Guest network with strong WIFI signal. Contact the school or 1-844-450-6500 for access code.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h2.div: FCAHS Alumni Homecoming has been cancelled.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.strong: Any students needing Chromebook repairs or Chromebook Charger replacement needs to contact Sherri McCain in the IT Department and make an appointment. You can call 601-606-5500 or email Sherri McCain at smccain@forrestcountyahs.com.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-wNfPc jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

div.p: Forrest County Agricultural High School was established in 1911 by an act of the Mississippi Legislation as an agricultural boarding school located on 320 acres of donated land. Students from across Mississippi, the United States, and several foreign countries have been educated here. In 1996, the school was listed as a Mississippi landmark by the historical society.

Today, FCAHS serves students in grades 9 through 12. We provide all of the offerings of a larger metropolitan city school in a small educational setting. It is our belief that all students can meet high standards for rigorous academic work. With that in mind, we offer advanced academic coursework as well as advisory services that support students at all levels of academic progress.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-wNfPc jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Forrest County Agricultural High School,
Brooklyn, MS

p.strong: Our mission is to provide a positive learning atmosphere by empowering students to achieve academic and career-technical success while preparing them for future endeavors.

div.p: Copyright © 2009-2020 Welcome to Forrest County AHS. All Rights Reserved.
